thread.title: National Analyst: Steve Patterson was 'too arrogant' for Texas
thread.title_full: National Analyst: Steve Patterson was 'too arrogant' for Texas | Dallas Morning News

author: Nick Castillo
title: National Analyst: Steve Patterson was 'too arrogant' for Texas
text:
Campus Insiders' Ted Emrich said Longhorn Athletic Director Steve Patterson had 'alienated everybody on campus and beyond â“ from the fan base at large, to donors, to coaches.'
Patterson has been fired, sources told Dallas Morning News reporter Chuck Carlton.
Emrich said Texas football head coach Charlie Strong can't afford another bad season as the new athletic director would want his own guy or at least see improvement.
He also said the push for former Longhorn coach Mack Brown for athletic director is a bad idea.
"How is that going to work? So the fired head coach at Texas is going to be the boss of his successor? I though Texas was done with dysfunction at this point," Emrich said.
He added that TCU Athletic Director Chris Del Conte and NCAA executive Oliver Luck are two candidates to watch.
More on split of Texas, Steve Patterson
(Eric Gay/AP)
